result.execSummary:
The defendant Halen A Gorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid at the rate of no less than $25 per month.

Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF370 and 14CF735 called: 2:35pm
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Jim Kurszewski.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed. Amended Information filed in 13CF370

State moves to:
14CF735>>D&RI
14CF370 - Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners/Repeater)>>AMEND to Misd Battery/Repeater
ADD Ct. 2 of DC/Repeater
ADD Ct. 3 of DC/Repeater
COURT GRANTS ABOVE and receives Amended Information as filed with new charges.

PLEA: 
14CF370 - Ct. 1 (Misd Battery/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
14CF370 - Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
14CF370 - Ct. 3 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on all 3 counts; 2 years probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: CC; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Restitution of $227.12 in 14CF370 to be paid at the rate of no less than $25 per month.
